text:
since the julia files are declarative, I’ve seen people write stuff like this:
```function main()
    # main method
end

# at the bottom of your file
main()```
simple and clear

text: What do u mean declarative, isnt python that as well <@UN97XTLCV>

elements.text: What do u mean declarative, isnt python that as well

text:
the file `file.jl` will have the exact same effect if you do
```$ julia file.jl```
or
```julia> include("file.jl")```
. The file will be parsed line by line, so if you just throw the function execution at the bottom of the file, it’ll be executed, no matter how you “read” the file. Basically Python has special rules for script execution vs. importing a file, but Julia doesn’t. Both are declarative.
